updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-tp-severity
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-tp-severity
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Enable Malware active & Enable Malware license
2. Select any app/app category/app instance which supports Malware scanning/DLP.
3. Enable Malware File scaning and select 'Default Anti-Malware scan'
4. Select either Upload/Downlod or both the activities.
5. Select Low Severity,Medium Severity & high severity and change the values of them as per user needs.
Eg:
Low Severity --> Alert
Medium Severity --> User Alert
High Severity --> Block
6. Upload/Download infected files with low,medium & high severity.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
Please confirm if there is any log containing ISSUE DETECTED
Eg: ISSUE DETECTED: Mismatched authentication

updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-tp-malware-name
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-tp-malware-name
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Restart mtnsproxy  ( to have empty user table)
2. Enable log levels tcp trans_event 1 user 3 httpmod httpreq 4 httpauth 5 
3. Download a Malware. One with common name and another with long file name
4. Collect transaction events
5. Compared with expected results
6. Collect the log (please separate log for every access method )
updated_cases.custom_expected:
Please confirm if there is any log containing ISSUE DETECTED
Eg: ISSUE DETECTED: Mismatched authentication

updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-tp-engine
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-tp-engine
updated_cases.custom_steps: Should follow TSS team engine using
updated_cases.custom_expected:
Please confirm if there is any log containing ISSUE DETECTED
Eg: ISSUE DETECTED: Mismatched authentication

updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to block
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to block
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to block traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
3. Sending traffic will access facebook
4. Traffic should be blocked
5. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action: block
x-action-reason: policy
x-policy-action: block
x-policy-name: "RTP Policy Name"
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: "SSL policy name"
x-error: policy
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to allow
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to allow
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to allow traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
3. Sending traffic will access facebook
4. Traffic should be allowed
5. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action: allow
x-action-reason: policy
x-policy-action: allow
x-policy-name: "RTP Policy Name"
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: -
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to bypass
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to bypass
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to bypass traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
3. Sending traffic will access facebook
4. Traffic should be bypass
5. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action: 
x-action-reason: policy
x-policy-action: bypass
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: X
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with default RTP policy allow
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with default RTP policy allow
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Removed all the others RTP Policy
2. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
3. Sending traffic will access facebook
4. Since non of the policy match, apply the default policy action which is to "Allow".
5. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action: allow
x-action-reason: policy
x-policy-action: allow_default
x-policy-name: "Default Allow"
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: X
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will proceed
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will proceed
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to alert traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Adding User notification template here to make sure user can proceed
3. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
4. Sending traffic will access facebook
5. A notification should pop up when traffic is landing on proxy
6. User press "proceed" button and facebook should be accessed
7. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action: allow
x-action-reason: justification-?
x-policy-action: useralert
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: X
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will cancel
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will cancel
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to alert traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Adding User notification template here to make sure user can cancel
3. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
4. Sending traffic will access facebook
5. A notification should pop up when traffic is landing on proxy
6. User press "cancel" button and facebook should not be accessed
7. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action: block
x-action-reason: justification-?
x-policy-action: useralert
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: policy
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and timeout
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and timeout
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to alert traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Adding User notification template here to make sure user can cancel
3. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
4. Sending traffic will access facebook
5. A notification should pop up when traffic is landing on proxy
6. User do nothing and wait for timeout 
7. facebook should not be accessed
8. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action: block
x-action-reason: justification-timeout
x-policy-action: useralert
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: policy
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>
